001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006/**
007 * Represents a specialized loss function that operates on a single dimension
008 * of a predicted versus target value. Implementations of this interface define
009 * how the "dimension loss" and corresponding gradient are computed.
010 */
011@DomainObject
012@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
013public interface DimensionLossFunction extends LossFunction {
014
015    /**
016     * Calculates the loss for a single dimension, given the estimated value
017     * and the target value.
018     *
019     * @param estimated the predicted or estimated value
020     * @param target    the expected or target value
021     * @return the loss for this dimension as a {@code float}
022     */
023    float calculateDimensionLoss(float estimated, float target);
024
025    /**
026     * Determines the gradient of the loss function with respect to the
027     * estimated value, for a single dimension.
028     *
029     * @param estimated the predicted or estimated value
030     * @param target    the expected or target value
031     * @return the gradient as a {@code float}
032     */
033    float determineGradient(float estimated, float target);
034
035}
